name: furnace production, logs, hardwood storage area, 6kW | furnace, logs, hardwood storage area, 6kW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9168/documentation

This dataset represents the individual components of a 6 kW furnace. This category includes wood-fueled cooking stoves, tile stoves and closed cheminées, which serve as additional heating or as heating of a living room. The furnace is refilled per hand.

From unoccupied land forseen for the construction of a furnace.

This activity ends with a constructed furnace, having a lifetime of 20 years (chimney 80 years). The dataset includes apart the materials necessary for the furnace also the construction efforts, land use for hardwood storage, transport as well as the disposal of all materials.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2815:Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Some data used to calculate averages are from the second half of the 1990´s.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for specific Swiss furnaces. Dataset could be used for similarly dimensioned furnaces in other regions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Boiler of average technology available on market.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data are from literature and personal communication.

exchanges.description: It is assumed that the boiler is produced in Switzerland, having a lifetime of 20 years. The boiler consists of a steel shell, a combustion chamber which is lined with concrete or ceramic tiles and insulation materials for thermal insulation. Modern boilers are equipped with one or two fans that regulate the supply air and exhaust gas flow. They have water pumps and the appropriate control technology to regulate the transport of water in the heating circuit. Based on the annual operating statistics of Tiba AG, the material consumption of the boiler is estimated. The data are based only on information provided by one manufacturer that produces boilers up to 100kW. The available operating statistics of 2000 records all boilers with different nominal capacities together. The combustion process of logs can be less controlled than the combustion process of wood chips and therefore has to be operated at full load. To use the released heat, a heat accumulator is necessary. The heat accumulator consists of a steel shell and an additional insulation. Apart from the boiler and heat accumulator a chimney and a heat distribution system is needed in the building. Therefore, the information of heating oil ist taken and adapted to the corresponding capacity. The chimney is constructed of three-layered chimney bricks. Therefore concrete and stone wool is needed. The lifetime of 80 years is estimated. The possible losses of heat distribution in a local district heating network are not included in the annual use efficiencies. The installation is assumed to be in a building or industrial site. For the distribution of heat circulation pumps, valves, control elements and cables are required. Lifetime is assumed to be 20 years.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. In order to produce the furnace, energy in the form of heat is needed. From operation statistics of Tiba AG the annual consumption is taken and divided or extrapolated according to the capacity. It is assumed that the heat demand is covered by an oil-fired furnace.
